replies.msg:
(代Post)
Although not all military units are combat units, most have to go through basic training, which is essentially combat training. I would know. I was a sergeant in a combat unit. See the photo above.

Tips:
Build your stamina. You can't even outrun the police while they are wearing equipment, vests, helmets, and long sleeves uniform on a hot day, don't even think about outrunning them while you're in black Bloc and full gear.

Train yourselves by running with full gear in order to condition yourselves regularly.

Learn close combat, particularly krav maga. Search Master Wong on YouTube. And practise the right techniques until you're confident. Go for the groins, not the head. Disable them in the most effective way.

If you plan to use a "weapon", make sure you know how to handle the weapon. Don't just take something and be clumsy with it.

If you notice, when the police rush at you, they will shout. This gives them a psychological boost while giving you the frights. Learn to shout back. You easily outnumber them despite their weapons. Practice this as well, in groups, remember to keep your formation.

I've got no tips for the water cannon trucks. But dose their windshield with paint and the truck would be motionless.

Resting vehicles are susceptible to punctured tyres. Think of something.

The riot police's uniform is fireproof. If petrol bombs don't work, why not try water?

Be water.

replies.msg:
The advantage of the police is that they have pre operations planning. They know how to surround you once you get lured into a particular area. You see that at times, they move backwards instead of fighting, it could be that they are purposely drawing you into an inescapable area. You should always keep the escape routes clear. Don't run mindlessly, the police are hoping that you will do that where you will fall into their traps. Why not consider a counter surrounding tactic, just like Wei Qi chess?

Have you heard of bear traps? They might be useful. Just make sure everyone knows where they're laid.

The riot police with the tall rectangular shields: just dose them with paint and they'll be forced to move their heads outside.

This is war, and if you're I'll prepared, you won't win. In the preparation for war, one must undergo strict physical and tactical training.

And I was laughing because you guys were quarrelling before about whether it's 5 demands or 6 demands. Your objective is not clear. You have to reach a consensus.

Learn to throw properly, whether it's TG or petrol bombs. Study the baseball throwing method and practise throwing. There are actually techniques where you can throw very far by using the right muscles (hint: it's the core muscles, not the arm).

Winter is coming. The dynamics of winter would be slightly different. Start preparing.

If you have money, invest in long sleeves, trousers, gloves, first aid dressing to diminish the effects of the TG.

replies.msg: that's right, make sure everyone are get mentally ready to fight and kill CHINAZI

Military people understand the difference between wining a battle and wining the war. There may be battles on the streets, but the war is in the media. On the streets, the police are nothing but fuel to keep the protests in the news.

Advocating personal combat training is useful for a select few braves, no more. And, it's important that they not be too successful. The police must remain dominant, according to the news. The must be using superior force. They must be better trained. The must be seen using their superior force and training in excessively violent ways. Effective protesting is drawing the police into this, and in this the HK protesters are off-the-scale awesome.

There was a video where some police were attacking some guy, don't even know if he was a protester. They were clearly using excessive force. The crowd, outnumbering and surrounding the police, reacted. They used just enough force to make the clearly alarmed police retreat. That crowd showed restraint. They could have torn those cops to pieces, and some looked like they wanted to, but they didn't. That is a victory video. Victory is not expertly-wielded improvised weapons to beat up cops. It's a riot cop in full gear retreating from a crowd of pissed-off civilians batting with umbrellas.

The war is being fought in the media. There is no victory on the streets. Mass-surrender on the streets, 10000 people demanding they be arrested for wearing a mask, would be way more effective than 100 guys punching through some police line. I really don't know why they don't plan for mass-arrests. Just flood the police right at the start, overwhelm their ability to arrest, then have the real protest march.

Though, I've got to admit, I'd love to see the protesters roll over that water truck That would make a good video too... all that blue water spilling out like an over-sized blood stain. A few of those lamp posts they cut down would make excellent levers... if enough protesters got involved. Maybe wait until the truck was mostly empty to make it lighter... just say'in. Probably crazy dangerous though.

replies.msg:
HK is the front line in a media war. If it were a real shooting war, HK would cease to exist and be entirely irrelevant in a very short period of time. It is indefensible, being dependent on the mainland for water, and is very close to a nation that happens to have the largest infantry reserves in the world. HK is not going to be a battleground. If the people of HK tried to make HK a battleground, they would cease to exist in short order and accomplish nothing in the process. Not a good idea.

Odds are, any "military" victory by the protesters would immediately result in the end of all street protests. And, it would give reasonable justification to the PLA rolling in to do this. That would be counter-productive in the media war. The street protests are important because they keep the protests in the world news. Staying in the news is winning. Winning is inventing some new "cool" protest technique that makes the news. Winning is stressing the police out until they overreact in some news-worthy way, again and again and again.

If there's going to be a shooting war, it will be in Taiwan. If that happens, HK simply won't matter, at least in the short-term.

Sorry, I know the Braves and Wizards are impressive and all, and what they're doing is necessary, but the real fighters are the graphic artists, the coders, the people figuring out how to keep these protests in the news. You can't win a "hearts and minds" war on the streets.

I've said it before. The HK police are nothing but fuel to keep the protests in the news. Nothing more. The Braves just have to keep poking them, provoking them to do news-worthy-stupid things.

Train yourselves by running with full gear in order to condition yourselves regularly.

Learn close combat, particularly krav maga. Search Master Wong on YouTube. And practise the right techniques until you're confident. Go for the groins, not the head. Disable them in the most effective way.

If you plan to use a "weapon", make sure you know how to handle the weapon. Don't just take something and be clumsy with it.

If you notice, when the police rush at you, they will shout. This gives them a psychological boost while giving you the frights. Learn to shout back. You easily outnumber them despite their weapons. Practice this as well, in groups, remember to keep your formation.
